tweet:
Last night I stood in support of the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act. It should shock our consciences that Congress voted down this bill.

There should be no debate that a child who is born alive should be cared for and protected. pic.twitter.com/dwCwvS9f8O

In today's “compromise” – Congress could not find $5.7 billion for a barrier that Customs and Border Protection has requested to help end the humanitarian crisis on our border.

Yet the bill contains more than $12 billion in international assistance.

#CongressIsBroken

Party leaders sent us an 1169-page bill this morning. Vote is this evening.

As of 1pm, congressional offices were calling each other to see if anyone even knew the total cost

I cosponsored a 1-week extension to fund the gov't while we #ReadTheBill & negotiate a real compromise

SURVEY: The support shown for the “Green New Deal” – including from several presidential candidates - is alarming. It would be nothing short of an unprecedented socialist reorganization of our society.

Please let me know what you think:  https://bit.ly/2tb1HzH

During #SOTU, I appreciated the discussion of how we came together during WWII - there’s more that unites than divides us. Congress must put aside party politics, recognize that ending the humanitarian crisis on our border should not be a partisan issue
